thread.title: Victory keeps Scorpions in playoff hunt
thread.title_full: Victory keeps Scorpions in playoff hunt - San Antonio Express-News

author: Staff report
title: Victory keeps Scorpions in playoff hunt
text:
INDIANAPOLIS — Kris Tyrpak’s 79th-minute goal, his second tally in as many games with the team, lifted the Scorpions to a 2-1 victory over the Indy Eleven on Saturday night and kept their slim playoff hopes alive.
Marvin Chávez set up both goals for the Scorpions (7-8-11, 29 points), who are six points out of the final spot in the NASL postseason with two matches to play. The defending champions will need to win both and have several other results fall their way to qualify.
On the winning goal, Chávez worked his way into Indy’s 18-yard-box and drew defenders before finding Tyrpak, who finished inside the far post past goalkeeper Keith Cardona . In the 19th minute, Chávez broke free on a counter attack and passed to the left wing to Giuseppe Gentile, who sent a low shot inside the far post to put the Scorpions ahead 1-0.
Indy Eleven (6-9-12, 27 points) got even in the 69th minute after a scramble in the Scorpions’ box. Marvin Ceballos lifted the ball over the San Antonio defense to an unmarked Dylan Mares , who beat goalkeeper Daniel Fernandes to make it 1-1 before Tyrpak put the Scorpions back ahead to stay.
